meanings.definition: A person who renounces a religious or political belief.
meanings.sent1: The apostates were once devout followers of the faith.
meanings.sent2: The community shunned the apostates after they left the political party.
meanings.sent3: The apostates decided to start a book club instead of attending church.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of beliefs, the apostates were like fallen leaves, drifting away.
meanings.sent5: The apostates' departure from the group was as noticeable as a missing puzzle piece.

meanings.definition: To abandon a religious or political belief.
meanings.sent1: She apostates her old beliefs and embraced a new ideology.
meanings.sent2: They apostates their allegiance to the ruling party.
meanings.sent3: The politician apostates his promises as easily as changing clothes.
meanings.sent4: Like a ship without a captain, he apostates his faith and drifted aimlessly.
meanings.sent5: The decision to apostates their religion was as monumental as a mountain crumbling.
